ENN.net

Class NeuralNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ENN.net.NeuralNet

  • public class NeuralNet
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for creating simple and easy to use neural networks.
    This version can create 3 layered neural networks. The coming versions would support multi-layer as well as many more features.
    You can also use the draw() method to draw the neural network on the screen
    IMPORTANT: You need to import the processing-3 library to use the drawing feature

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      byte _tSize
      byte variable - Stores the text size for the displayed text
      double[] d
      double 1D array to store the desired output for a given set of inputs as an example for backpropagation (Supervised Learning)
      RECOMMENDED: Use setRequired(double[]) to set the desired output for the already set input
      int hid
      integer variable - Stores number of hidden neurons
      double[] i
      double 1D array for storing the inputs to input neuron
      NOTE: to access the nth input, use i[n]
      int in
      integer variable - Stores number of input neurons
      double[] j
      double 1D array for storing the values of hidden neurons
      NOTE: to access the nth hidden neuron, use j[n]
      double[] jSum
      Stores the weighted sum of the hidden neuron inputs
      double[] k
      double 1D array for storing the outputs of the network (output neurons)
      NOTE: to access the nth output, use k[n]
      double[] kSum
      Stores the weighted sum of the output neuron inputs
      double LR
      double variable to store the Learning Rate for the network
      RECOMMENDED: choose the Learning Rate carefully according to your project and once set, don't change it during the learning process
      int out
      integer variable - Stores number of output neurons
      byte[] output
      byte 1D array to store the output in binary form
      RECOMMENDED: use this as the true output and k[] as the confidence level.
      byte size
      byte variable - Stores the size of the circular neuron when drawing.
      double[][] w1
      double 2D array for storing weights from input layer to hidden layer
      NOTE: For weight of connection from input neuron i to hidden neuron j, use - w1[i][j]
      double[][] w2
      double 2D array for storing weights of connections from hidden layer to output layer
      NOTE: For weight of connection from hidden neuron j to output neuron k, use - w2[i][j]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NeuralNet(int _in, int _hid, int _out, double _LR)
      Constructor for creating a Neural Network (which cannot be drawn on PApplet; for drawing use the constructor with PApplet argument)
      NeuralNet(int _in, int _hid, int _out, double _LR, processing.core.PApplet _parent)
      Constructor for creating a Neural Network (which can be drawn on a PApplet)
      NeuralNet(java.lang.String file, processing.core.PApplet _parent)
      Constructor for creating a Neural Network from a saved file

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Method for activating the neural network and calculating the output
      void backProp()
      Method for performing the back propagation and updating the weights according to error gradients
      NOTE:Call activate method before calling backProp or use the 'learn' method for learning process
      void binCalc()
      Calculates the binary form of the output values in k[]
      If k is greater than 0.5 the output is 1 otherwise 0
      NeuralNet cloneNet()
      Function to clone the neural network object to create a similar object
      NeuralNet cross(NeuralNet net)
      Function to cross over the genes of the Neural Network with a given Neural Network to produce a child neural network.
      void draw(int X1, int Y1, int X2, int Y2)
      A method that draws the neural network on the screen(PApplet) within the area given as parameter
      NOTE: This method would not do anything if the PApplet is not provided
      boolean load(java.lang.String file)
      Method for loading the weights from a file
      NeuralNet mutate(int MODE)
      Function to mutate the neural network mith given mode ALL - Mutates all the weights SINGLE - Mutates the least important weight
      NeuralNet mutateAll()
      A method for mutating the neural network and return a new one.
      NeuralNet mutateLeast()
      Mutates the least important weights in the network
      Mutates the least important wights between each layer
      void save(java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves the neural network to a file
      DO NOT MENTION THE FILE EXTENSION
      void setActivation(Function _activation)
      Method for setting the activation function of the network
      You can implement a class from the Function interface for your own activation function
      Or you can use some of the already available activation functions from the ENN.net.activation package
      void setFont(processing.core.PFont font)
      Method for setting the font used while drawing the neural network
      void setRequired(double[] _d)
      Method for setting the required output for a given set of inputs
      void setWeights()
      Method to set the weights of connections between neurons to random values
      IMPORTANT: To be used at initial stage ONLY.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        double 2D array for storing weights from input layer to hidden layer

        double 2D array for storing weights of connections from hidden layer to output layer
        NOTE: For weight of connection from hidden neuron j to output neuron k, use - w2[i][j]

        double 1D array for storing the inputs to input neuron

        double 1D array for storing the values of hidden neurons
        NOTE: to access the nth hidden neuron, use j[n]

        double 1D array for storing the outputs of the network (output neurons)
        NOTE: to access the nth output, use k[n]

        public double[] d
        double 1D array to store the desired output for a given set of inputs as an example for backpropagation (Supervised Learning)
        RECOMMENDED: Use setRequired(double[]) to set the desired output for the already set input

      • LR

        public double LR
        double variable to store the Learning Rate for the network
        RECOMMENDED: choose the Learning Rate carefully according to your project and once set, don't change it during the learning process

      • output

        public byte[] output
        byte 1D array to store the output in binary form
        RECOMMENDED: use this as the true output and k[] as the confidence level.

      • size

        public byte size
        byte variable - Stores the size of the circular neuron when drawing. Set it according to your screen size

        public byte _tSize
        byte variable - Stores the text size for the displayed text

        integer variable - Stores number of input neurons

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(int _in,
                 int _hid,
                 int _out,
                 double _LR,
                 processing.core.PApplet _parent)
        Constructor for creating a Neural Network (which can be drawn on a PApplet)
        Parameters:
        _in - number of inputs
        _hid - number of hidden neurons
        _out - number of outputs
        _LR - the learning rate for the neural network
        _parent - the PApplet for drawing (recommended to use for better training)

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(int _in,
                 int _hid,
                 int _out,
                 double _LR)
        Constructor for creating a Neural Network (which cannot be drawn on PApplet; for drawing use the constructor with PApplet argument)
        Parameters:
        _in - number of inputs
        _hid - number of hidden neurons
        _out - number of outputs
        _LR - the learning rate for the neural network

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(java.lang.String file,
                 processing.core.PApplet _parent)
        Constructor for creating a Neural Network from a saved file
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which the neural network is saved (with '.swts' extension)
        _parent - the PApplet for drawing (recommended to use for better training) NOTE: Do not mention any extension with file name. Only mention the file name Exits if file not loaded

    • Method Detail

      • setFont

        public void setFont(processing.core.PFont font)
        Method for setting the font used while drawing the neural network
        Parameters:
        font - the font used while drawing the neural network (PFont)

      • setActivation

        public void setActivation(Function _activation)
        Method for setting the activation function of the network
        You can implement a class from the Function interface for your own activation function
        Or you can use some of the already available activation functions from the ENN.net.activation package
        Parameters:
        _activation - the activation function as Function object(from ENN.math package);

      • load

        public boolean load(java.lang.String file)
        Method for loading the weights from a file
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which the neural network is saved (with '.swts' extension)
        Returns:
        returns true if the file is successfully loaded or false

      • setRequired

        public void setRequired(double[] _d)
        Method for setting the required output for a given set of inputs
        Parameters:
        _d - the array of the required outputs (should be of the same length as k[])

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Method for activating the neural network and calculating the output

      • setWeights

        public void setWeights()
        Method to set the weights of connections between neurons to random values
        IMPORTANT: To be used at initial stage ONLY. Not during the learning process

      • backProp

        public void backProp()
        Method for performing the back propagation and updating the weights according to error gradients
        NOTE:Call activate method before calling backProp or use the 'learn' method for learning process

      • draw

        public void draw(int X1,
                 int Y1,
                 int X2,
                 int Y2)
        A method that draws the neural network on the screen(PApplet) within the area given as parameter
        NOTE: This method would not do anything if the PApplet is not provided
        Parameters:
        X1 - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangular area of drawing
        Y1 - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangular area of drawing
        X2 - The x-coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangular area of drawing
        Y2 - The y-coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangular area of drawing

      • binCalc

        public void binCalc()
        Calculates the binary form of the output values in k[]
        If k is greater than 0.5 the output is 1 otherwise 0

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the neural network to a file
        DO NOT MENTION THE FILE EXTENSION
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file in which the neural network is to be stored

      • mutateAll

        public NeuralNet mutateAll()
        A method for mutating the neural network and return a new one. This works on the theory of evolution. Use where you have MANY neural networks and back-propagation cannot be used.
        Returns:
        The mutated Neural Network

      • mutateLeast

        public NeuralNet mutateLeast()
        Mutates the least important weights in the network
        Mutates the least important wights between each layer
        Returns:
        The mutated neural network

      • cross

        public NeuralNet cross(NeuralNet net)
        Function to cross over the genes of the Neural Network with a given Neural Network to produce a child neural network. It also mutates the child. (Use for Evolutionary Networks)
        Parameters:
        net - The other parent network (other than 'this')
        Returns:
        The child network

      • mutate

        public NeuralNet mutate(int MODE)
        Function to mutate the neural network mith given mode ALL - Mutates all the weights SINGLE - Mutates the least important weight
        Parameters:
        MODE - The MODE of mutation
        Returns:
        The mutated neural network

      • cloneNet

        public NeuralNet cloneNet()
        Function to clone the neural network object to create a similar object
        Returns:
        The clone Neural Network
